definition[0]: to be very easy to see or notice
example[0]: The outlines of rooftops and chimneys stood out against the pale sky.
example[1]: She always stood out in a crowd.
example[2]: I am sure illnesses stand out in all childhood memories.
definition[1]: to be much better than other similar people or things
example[3]: That day still stands out as the greatest day in my life.
example[4]: Three of the cars we tested stood out among the rest.
definition[2]: to rise up from a surface
example[5]: The veins stood out on his throat and temples.
